Domain-Focused Advanced Software-Reconfigurable Heterogenous SoC Simulator

1 """!
2 @brief internal implementation used for scheduling a task DAG with any of the PEFT family of algorithms
3 """
4 
5 from collections import deque, namedtuple
6 from math import inf
7 from peft.gantt import showGanttChart
8 from types import SimpleNamespace
9 
10 import argparse
11 import logging
12 import numpy as np
13 import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
14 import networkx as nx
15 
16 logger = logging.getLogger('peft')
17 
18 ScheduleEvent = namedtuple('ScheduleEvent', 'task start end proc')
19 
20 """!
21 Default computation matrix - taken from Arabnejad 2014 PEFT paper
22 computation matrix: v x q matrix with v tasks and q PEs
23 """
24 W0 = np.array([
25  [22, 21, 36],
26  [22, 18, 18],
27  [32, 27, 19],
28  [7, 10, 17],
29  [29, 27, 10],
30  [26, 17, 9],
31  [14, 25, 11],
32  [29, 23, 14],
33  [15, 21, 20],
34  [13, 16, 16]
35 ])
36 
37 """!
38 Default communication matrix - not listed in Arabnejad 2014 PEFT paper
39 communication matrix: q x q matrix with q PEs
40 
41 Note that a communication cost of 0 is used for a given processor to itself
42 """
43 C0 = np.array([
44  [0, 1, 1],
45  [1, 0, 1],
46  [1, 1, 0]
47 ])
48 
49 def schedule_dag(dag, computation_matrix=W0, communication_matrix=C0, proc_schedules=None, time_offset=0, relabel_nodes=True):
50  """!
51  Given an application DAG and a set of matrices specifying PE bandwidth and (task, pe) execution times, computes the PEFT schedule
52  of that DAG onto that set of PEs
53 
54  @param dag: a NetworkX DiGraph instance that contains all the tasks to be scheduled as well as their dependency and communication volume relationships
55  @param computation_matrix: the matrix of task to PE computation cost estimates used to inform scheduling decisions
56  @param communication_matrix: the matrix of PE to PE communication cost estimates used to inform scheduling decisions
57  @param proc_schedules: if existing schedules need to be passed in to PEFT (i.e. we are not scheduling onto an idle system), then they can be passed in as fixed constraints here
58  @param time_offset: if the schedule here should be generated relative to some time offset rather than the current instance, specify so here
59  @param relabel_nodes: if the nodes in the incoming DAG need to be relabeled to not conflict with tasks specified in the proc_schedules constraints, specify so here
60  """
61  if proc_schedules == None:
62  proc_schedules = {}
63 
64  _self = {
65  'computation_matrix': computation_matrix,
66  'communication_matrix': communication_matrix,
67  'task_schedules': {},
68  'proc_schedules': proc_schedules,
69  'numExistingJobs': 0,
70  'time_offset': time_offset,
71  'root_node': None,
72  'optimistic_cost_table': None
73  }
74  _self = SimpleNamespace(**_self)
75 
76  for proc in proc_schedules:
77  _self.numExistingJobs = _self.numExistingJobs + len(proc_schedules[proc])
78 
79  if relabel_nodes:
80  dag = nx.relabel_nodes(dag, dict(map(lambda node: (node, node+_self.numExistingJobs), list(dag.nodes()))))
81  else:
82  #Negates any offsets that would have been needed had the jobs been relabeled
83  _self.numExistingJobs = 0
84 
85  for i in range(_self.numExistingJobs + len(_self.computation_matrix)):
86  _self.task_schedules[i] = None
87  for i in range(len(_self.communication_matrix)):
88  if i not in _self.proc_schedules:
89  _self.proc_schedules[i] = []
90 
91  for proc in proc_schedules:
92  for schedule_event in proc_schedules[proc]:
93  _self.task_schedules[schedule_event.task] = schedule_event
94 
95  # Nodes with no successors cause the any expression to be empty
96  root_node = [node for node in dag.nodes() if not any(True for _ in dag.predecessors(node))]
97  assert len(root_node) == 1, f"Expected a single root node, found {len(root_node)}"
98  root_node = root_node[0]
99  _self.root_node = root_node
100 
101  logger.debug(""); logger.debug("====================== Performing Optimistic Cost Table Computation ======================\n"); logger.debug("")
102  _self.optimistic_cost_table = _compute_optimistic_cost_table(_self, dag)
103 
104  logger.debug(""); logger.debug("====================== Computing EFT for each (task, processor) pair and scheduling in order of decreasing Rank-U ======================"); logger.debug("")
105  sorted_nodes = sorted(dag.nodes(), key=lambda node: dag.nodes()[node]['rank'], reverse=True)
106  if sorted_nodes[0] != root_node:
107  logger.debug("Root node was not the first node in the sorted list. Must be a zero-cost and zero-weight placeholder node. Rearranging it so it is scheduled first\n")
108  idx = sorted_nodes.index(root_node)
109  sorted_nodes[idx], sorted_nodes[0] = sorted_nodes[0], sorted_nodes[idx]
110  logger.debug(f"Scheduling tasks in this order: {sorted_nodes}")
111  for node in sorted_nodes:
112  if _self.task_schedules[node] is not None:
113  continue
114  minTaskSchedule = ScheduleEvent(node, inf, inf, -1)
115  minOptimisticCost = inf
116  for proc in range(len(communication_matrix)):
117  taskschedule = _compute_eft(_self, dag, node, proc)
118  if (taskschedule.end + _self.optimistic_cost_table[node][proc] < minTaskSchedule.end + minOptimisticCost):
119  minTaskSchedule = taskschedule
120  minOptimisticCost = _self.optimistic_cost_table[node][proc]
121  _self.task_schedules[node] = minTaskSchedule
122  _self.proc_schedules[minTaskSchedule.proc].append(minTaskSchedule)
123  _self.proc_schedules[minTaskSchedule.proc] = sorted(_self.proc_schedules[minTaskSchedule.proc], key=lambda schedule_event: schedule_event.end)
124  if logger.isEnabledFor(logging.DEBUG):
125  logger.debug('\n')
126  for proc, jobs in _self.proc_schedules.items():
127  logger.debug(f"Processor {proc} has the following jobs:")
128  logger.debug(f"\t{jobs}")
129  logger.debug('\n')
130  for proc in range(len(_self.proc_schedules)):
131  for job in range(len(_self.proc_schedules[proc])-1):
132  first_job = _self.proc_schedules[proc][job]
133  second_job = _self.proc_schedules[proc][job+1]
134  assert first_job.end <= second_job.start, \
135  f"Jobs on a particular processor must finish before the next can begin, but job {first_job.task} on processor {first_job.proc} ends at {first_job.end} and its successor {second_job.task} starts at {second_job.start}"
136 
137  dict_output = {}
138  for proc_num, proc_tasks in _self.proc_schedules.items():
139  for idx, task in enumerate(proc_tasks):
140  if idx > 0 and (proc_tasks[idx-1].end - proc_tasks[idx-1].start > 0):
141  dict_output[task.task] = (proc_num, idx, [proc_tasks[idx-1].task])
142  else:
143  dict_output[task.task] = (proc_num, idx, [])
144 
145  return _self.proc_schedules, _self.task_schedules, dict_output
146 
147 def _compute_optimistic_cost_table(_self, dag):
148  """
149  Uses a basic BFS approach to traverse upwards through the graph building the optimistic cost table along the way
150  """
151 
152  optimistic_cost_table = {}
153 
154  terminal_node = [node for node in dag.nodes() if not any(True for _ in dag.successors(node))]
155  assert len(terminal_node) == 1, f"Expected a single terminal node, found {len(terminal_node)}"
156  terminal_node = terminal_node[0]
157 
158  diagonal_mask = np.ones(_self.communication_matrix.shape, dtype=bool)
159  np.fill_diagonal(diagonal_mask, 0)
160  avgCommunicationCost = np.mean(_self.communication_matrix[diagonal_mask])
161  for edge in dag.edges():
162  logger.debug(f"Assigning {edge}'s average weight based on average communication cost. {float(dag.get_edge_data(*edge)['weight'])} => {float(dag.get_edge_data(*edge)['weight']) / avgCommunicationCost}")
163  nx.set_edge_attributes(dag, { edge: float(dag.get_edge_data(*edge)['weight']) / avgCommunicationCost }, 'avgweight')
164 
165  optimistic_cost_table[terminal_node] = _self.computation_matrix.shape[1] * [0]
166  dag.nodes()[terminal_node]['rank'] = 0
167  visit_queue = deque(dag.predecessors(terminal_node))
168 
169  node_can_be_processed = lambda node: all(successor in optimistic_cost_table for successor in dag.successors(node))
170  while visit_queue:
171  node = visit_queue.pop()
172 
173  while node_can_be_processed(node) is not True:
174  try:
175  node2 = visit_queue.pop()
176  except IndexError:
177  raise RuntimeError(f"Node {node} cannot be processed, and there are no other nodes in the queue to process instead!")
178  visit_queue.appendleft(node)
179  node = node2
180 
181  optimistic_cost_table[node] = _self.computation_matrix.shape[1] * [0]
182  logger.debug(f"Computing optimistic cost table entries for node: {node}")
183 
184  # Perform OCT kernel
185  # Need to build the OCT entries for every task on each processor
186  for curr_proc in range(_self.computation_matrix.shape[1]):
187  # Need to maximize over all the successor nodes
188  max_successor_oct = -inf
189  for succnode in dag.successors(node):
190  logger.debug(f"\tLooking at successor node: {succnode}")
191  # Need to minimize over the costs across each processor
192  min_proc_oct = inf
193  for succ_proc in range(_self.computation_matrix.shape[1]):
194  successor_oct = optimistic_cost_table[succnode][succ_proc]
195  successor_comp_cost = _self.computation_matrix[succnode][succ_proc]
196  successor_comm_cost = dag[node][succnode]['avgweight'] if curr_proc != succ_proc else 0
197  cost = successor_oct + successor_comp_cost + successor_comm_cost
198  logger.debug(f"If node {node} is on {curr_proc} and successor {succnode} is on {succ_proc}, the optimistic cost entry is {cost}")
199  if cost < min_proc_oct:
200  min_proc_oct = cost
201  if min_proc_oct > max_successor_oct:
202  max_successor_oct = min_proc_oct
203  assert max_successor_oct != -inf, f"No node should have a maximum successor OCT of {-inf} but {node} does when looking at processor {curr_proc}"
204  optimistic_cost_table[node][curr_proc] = max_successor_oct
205  # End OCT kernel
206  dag.nodes()[node]['rank'] = np.mean(optimistic_cost_table[node])
207  visit_queue.extendleft([prednode for prednode in dag.predecessors(node) if prednode not in visit_queue])
208 
209  return optimistic_cost_table
210 
211 def _compute_eft(_self, dag, node, proc):
212  """
213  Computes the EFT of a particular node if it were scheduled on a particular processor
214  It does this by first looking at all predecessor tasks of a particular node and determining the earliest time a task would be ready for execution (ready_time)
215  It then looks at the list of tasks scheduled on this particular processor and determines the earliest time (after ready_time) a given node can be inserted into this processor's queue
216  """
217  ready_time = _self.time_offset
218  logger.debug(f"Computing EFT for node {node} on processor {proc}")
219  for prednode in list(dag.predecessors(node)):
220  predjob = _self.task_schedules[prednode]
221  assert predjob != None, f"Predecessor nodes must be scheduled before their children, but node {node} has an unscheduled predecessor of {prednode}"
222  logger.debug(f"\tLooking at predecessor node {prednode} with job {predjob} to determine ready time")
223  if _self.communication_matrix[predjob.proc, proc] == 0:
224  ready_time_t = predjob.end
225  else:
226  ready_time_t = predjob.end + dag[predjob.task][node]['weight'] / _self.communication_matrix[predjob.proc, proc]
227  logger.debug(f"\tNode {prednode} can have its data routed to processor {proc} by time {ready_time_t}")
228  if ready_time_t > ready_time:
229  ready_time = ready_time_t
230  logger.debug(f"\tReady time determined to be {ready_time}")
231 
232  computation_time = _self.computation_matrix[node-_self.numExistingJobs, proc]
233  job_list = _self.proc_schedules[proc]
234  for idx in range(len(job_list)):
235  prev_job = job_list[idx]
236  if idx == 0:
237  if (prev_job.start - computation_time) - ready_time > 0:
238  logger.debug(f"Found an insertion slot before the first job {prev_job} on processor {proc}")
239  job_start = ready_time
240  min_schedule = ScheduleEvent(node, job_start, job_start+computation_time, proc)
241  break
242  if idx == len(job_list)-1:
243  job_start = max(ready_time, prev_job.end)
244  min_schedule = ScheduleEvent(node, job_start, job_start + computation_time, proc)
245  break
246  next_job = job_list[idx+1]
247  #Start of next job - computation time == latest we can start in this window
248  #Max(ready_time, previous job's end) == earliest we can start in this window
249  #If there's space in there, schedule in it
250  logger.debug(f"\tLooking to fit a job of length {computation_time} into a slot of size {next_job.start - max(ready_time, prev_job.end)}")
251  if (next_job.start - computation_time) - max(ready_time, prev_job.end) >= 0:
252  job_start = max(ready_time, prev_job.end)
253  logger.debug(f"\tInsertion is feasible. Inserting job with start time {job_start} and end time {job_start + computation_time} into the time slot [{prev_job.end}, {next_job.start}]")
254  min_schedule = ScheduleEvent(node, job_start, job_start + computation_time, proc)
255  break
256  else:
257  #For-else loop: the else executes if the for loop exits without break-ing, which in this case means the number of jobs on this processor are 0
258  min_schedule = ScheduleEvent(node, ready_time, ready_time + computation_time, proc)
259  logger.debug(f"\tFor node {node} on processor {proc}, the EFT is {min_schedule}")
260  return min_schedule
261 
262 def readCsvToNumpyMatrix(csv_file):
263  """!
264  Given an input file consisting of a comma separated list of numeric values with a single header row and header column,
265  this function reads that data into a numpy matrix and strips the top row and leftmost column
266  """
267  with open(csv_file) as fd:
268  logger.debug(f"Reading the contents of {csv_file} into a matrix")
269  contents = fd.read()
270  contentsList = contents.split('\n')
271  contentsList = list(map(lambda line: line.split(','), contentsList))
272  contentsList = contentsList[0:len(contentsList)-1] if contentsList[len(contentsList)-1] == [''] else contentsList
273 
274  matrix = np.array(contentsList)
275  matrix = np.delete(matrix, 0, 0) # delete the first row (entry 0 along axis 0)
276  matrix = np.delete(matrix, 0, 1) # delete the first column (entry 0 along axis 1)
277  matrix = matrix.astype(float)
278  logger.debug(f"After deleting the first row and column of input data, we are left with this matrix:\n{matrix}")
279  return matrix
280 
281 def readCsvToDict(csv_file):
282  """!
283  Given an input file consisting of a comma separated list of numeric values with a single header row and header column,
284  this function reads that data into a dictionary with keys that are node numbers and values that are the CSV lists
285  """
286  with open(csv_file) as fd:
287  matrix = readCsvToNumpyMatrix(csv_file)
288 
289  outputDict = {}
290  for row_num, row in enumerate(matrix):
291  outputDict[row_num] = row
292  return outputDict
293 
294 def readDagMatrix(dag_file, show_dag=False):
295  """!
296  Given an input file consisting of a connectivity matrix, reads and parses it into a networkx Directional Graph (DiGraph)
297  """
298  matrix = readCsvToNumpyMatrix(dag_file)
299 
300  dag = nx.DiGraph(matrix)
301  dag.remove_edges_from(
302  # Remove all edges with weight of 0 since we have no placeholder for "this edge doesn't exist" in the input file
303  [edge for edge in dag.edges() if dag.get_edge_data(*edge)['weight'] == '0.0']
304  )
305 
306  if show_dag:
307  nx.draw(dag, pos=nx.nx_pydot.graphviz_layout(dag, prog='dot'), with_labels=True)
308  plt.show()
309 
310  return dag
311 
312 def generate_argparser():
313  """!
314  For when this peft library is being invoked as a standalone commandline application, generate an argparser
315  """
316  parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description="A tool for finding PEFT schedules for given DAG task graphs")
317  parser.add_argument("-d", "--dag_file",
318  help="File containing input DAG to be scheduled. Uses default 10 node dag from Arabnejad 2014 if none given.",
319  type=str, default="test/peftgraph_task_connectivity.csv")
320  parser.add_argument("-p", "--pe_connectivity_file",
321  help="File containing connectivity/bandwidth information about PEs. Uses a default 3x3 matrix from Arabnejad 2014 if none given.",
322  type=str, default="test/peftgraph_resource_BW.csv")
323  parser.add_argument("-t", "--task_execution_file",
324  help="File containing execution times of each task on each particular PE. Uses a default 10x3 matrix from Arabnejad 2014 if none given.",
325  type=str, default="test/peftgraph_task_exe_time.csv")
326  parser.add_argument("-l", "--loglevel",
327  help="The log level to be used in this module. Default: INFO",
328  type=str, default="INFO", dest="loglevel", choices=["DEBUG", "INFO", "WARNING", "ERROR", "CRITICAL"])
329  parser.add_argument("--showDAG",
330  help="Switch used to enable display of the incoming task DAG",
331  dest="showDAG", action="store_true")
332  parser.add_argument("--showGantt",
333  help="Switch used to enable display of the final scheduled Gantt chart",
334  dest="showGantt", action="store_true")
335  return parser
336 
337 if __name__ == "__main__":
338  argparser = generate_argparser()
339  args = argparser.parse_args()
340 
341  logger.setLevel(logging.getLevelName(args.loglevel))
342  consolehandler = logging.StreamHandler()
343  consolehandler.setLevel(logging.getLevelName(args.loglevel))
344  consolehandler.setFormatter(logging.Formatter("%(levelname)8s : %(name)16s : %(message)s"))
345  logger.addHandler(consolehandler)
346 
347  communication_matrix = readCsvToNumpyMatrix(args.pe_connectivity_file)
348  computation_matrix = readCsvToNumpyMatrix(args.task_execution_file)
349  dag = readDagMatrix(args.dag_file, args.showDAG)
350 
351  processor_schedules, _, _ = schedule_dag(dag, communication_matrix=communication_matrix, computation_matrix=computation_matrix)
352  for proc, jobs in processor_schedules.items():
353  logger.info(f"Processor {proc} has the following jobs:")
354  logger.info(f"\t{jobs}")
355  if args.showGantt:
356  showGanttChart(processor_schedules)
